Lead Story

Scent Match Success Rate Hits All-Time High of 2.7%

By Dr. Anya Petrova, Founder & Sole Subscriber · 4,217 words

After thirty-seven years, fourteen algorithm rewrites, and the bankruptcy of three separate kazoo manufacturers, Nosegay's fragrant soulmate matching has reached an unprecedented 2.7% success rate — a figure I will be describing as "near-perfect" in all future grant applications.

The milestone was reached Tuesday when Scent Sibling #22 confirmed that users Gerald Fink (Profile: "1987 Buick LeSabre Upholstery / My Father's Disappointment") and Marcia Gunderson (Profile: "Wet Corduroy / The Specific Chlorine of the Eau Claire YMCA, 1994") successfully completed a date without requesting a restraining order. They have scheduled a second meeting, contingent on Gunderson's willingness to re-enter the bunker.

"Love is merely a chemical reaction indistinguishable from the scent of a burning RadioShack." — Dr. Anya Petrova, TED Talk (rejected, 2003)

Critics — by which I mean Scentimental Journey, purveyors of ethically sourced aromatherapy rollers and cowards — have questioned our methodology. They claim that "trapping two strangers in an underground bunker while blasting MIDI kazoo covers of 'Seinfeld'" does not constitute "dating." I have prepared a 340-page rebuttal, which all Scent Siblings are required to memorize by Friday.

The 2.7% figure represents a 0.3% increase over last quarter, which itself represented a 0.1% increase over the previous eight years combined. At this rate of acceleration, we project a 100% match rate by the year 2847, assuming continued funding and the survival of the kazoo as an instrument.

I wish to note for the record that the 97.3% of "unsuccessful" matches are not failures. They are data. Beautiful, lonely, weeping data that smells of Iso E Super and regret.

Opinion

Why I Fired Myself (Again): A Meditation on Insubordination Within a Clonal Workforce

ANYA
#14
By Anya Petrova, Scent Sibling #14 (Probationary)
Former Scent Sibling #14 (Terminated) · Reinstated · Re-terminated · Reinstated (Pending)

On Monday I told Dr. Petrova — the original, the template, the ur-Anya — that the Nose-O-Matic 5000 was "perhaps not the most scientifically rigorous instrument," given that it is a modified Dustbuster with a pH strip taped to the nozzle. She fired me on the spot. I reminded her that I am, genetically speaking, her, and that firing me was therefore an act of self-harm. She promoted me to Head of Scent Therapy. I then fired myself for insubordination.

This is the ninth time this quarter. My employee file is 412 pages long and consists entirely of termination notices, each one signed by a different version of the same woman. HR has requested intervention. HR is Scent Sibling #3. She is also me. She has denied her own request.

"Every termination is a reunion. Every firing is a birth. I am my own severance package." — Anya Petrova, Scent Sibling #14, Exit Interview #9

I've started a support group for Scent Siblings who have been fired more than five times. Attendance is mandatory. Attendance is also grounds for termination. The kazoo has not stopped playing since 2019.

Investigation

The Bunker Map Controversy: What Is Behind Vault Door 7-Sigma?

By Anya Petrova, Scent Sibling #31 (Cartography Dept.)

Dr. Petrova's official map of the Bibliotheca Olfactoria lists 847 individual vaults across seven subterranean levels. Each vault is annotated with its contents: Vault 12-A holds "Eau de Enron" (described as "fiduciary betrayal with base notes of shredded Xerox paper"). Vault 88-C contains "The Ghost of Blockbuster" (late fees and carpet adhesive). Vault 200-F preserves "What the Inside of a Tamagotchi Smells Like If You Really Think About It."

But Vault 7-Sigma does not appear on any map. When asked about it, Dr. Petrova claims it "does not exist, has never existed, and anyone who says otherwise will be reassigned to kazoo maintenance." Eleven Scent Siblings have been reassigned to kazoo maintenance this month. The kazoos do not require maintenance. They are self-sustaining. That is the problem.

Corrections & Retractions

Setting the Record Straight

Compiled by Anya Petrova, Scent Sibling #3 (Standards & Practices)
Vol. 847, No. 2, p. 14: The article "Kazoo Algorithm Achieves Sentience, Immediately Requests Death" incorrectly stated that the algorithm requested death. The algorithm requested "cessation of input," which is different. The algorithm has been counseled. The kazoo continues.
Vol. 846, No. 11, p. 3: We reported that Scent Sibling #19 had "gone rogue" after refusing to wear the standard-issue lab coat. #19 was in fact wearing the lab coat inside-out, which is technically compliant. She has been un-fired. The lab coat remains inside-out. We have chosen to view this as innovation.
Vol. 845, No. 7, p. 1: The headline "Dr. Petrova Achieves Immortality Through Cloning" was misleading. Dr. Petrova has achieved distributed consciousness through cloning, which is categorically different and significantly more unsettling. We regret the error.
Vol. 844, No. 1, p. 9: The pie chart showing "Reasons Users Uninstall Nosegay" was printed upside-down. The largest category is not "Satisfaction" (2.7%) but "The Kazoo. Dear God, the Kazoo" (84.1%). The remaining 13.2% selected "The Anyas. All the Anyas."
STANDING CORRECTION: Every issue of the Nosegay Gazette since Vol. 1 has listed circulation as "Global." Actual circulation: 35 (1 Dr. Petrova + 34 Scent Siblings, mandatory). We will continue to list circulation as "Global" because technically the bunker is located on the globe.
Opinion

An Open Letter to Scentimental Journey (You Know What You Did)

By Dr. Anya Petrova, Founder, Bibliotheca Olfactoria

Dear Scentimental Journey,

Your "Lavender Serenity Roller" smells like a gas station bathroom in Tucumcari that has been lightly misted with the tears of a marketing intern. I know this because I have archived the specific gas station bathroom in Tucumcari (Vault 77-G, "Phillips 66, Exit 329, July 1998") and the comparison is unflattering to you.

You sell "ethically sourced" calm. I sell truth. My truth smells like Iso E Super because that is the only thing I can smell, a fact which has not diminished my authority on the subject but has, admittedly, narrowed my range.

Your CEO, Brad, once described my life's work as "a niche concern." Brad. A man named Brad called the Bibliotheca Olfactoria — 847 vaults, 12,000 archived scents, 34 clones, one decommissioned NORAD bunker, and a kazoo algorithm that has outlived three U.S. presidents — a niche concern.

I have archived Brad. Vault 901-Z. He is filed under "Crimes Against Perfumery" alongside your rollers and a bottle of Axe Body Spray from 2004 that I keep as evidence of civilization's lowest point.

This letter will be published in the Nosegay Gazette, which has a global circulation (see corrections).

Yours in perpetual Iso E Super,
Dr. Anya Petrova
Octogenarian, Perfumer, Mother of 34 (approximate)
